docs.snippet: Players from New York have anchored several of Coach Geno Auriemma’s eight national championship teams at the University of Connecticut....
docs.lead_paragraph: Players from New York have anchored several of Coach Geno Auriemma’s eight national championship teams at the University of Connecticut.
docs.abstract: Women's college basketball players from New York have anchored several of Coach Geno Auriemma’s eight national championship teams at University of Connecticut, with many developing into dependable leaders; No 1-seeded team defeated ninth-seeded St Joseph's in second round of NCAA tournament.

headline.main: For Connecticut, New York Has Provided a Foundation
headline.print_headline: Nurturing a New York Core at UConn

docs.snippet: Talks ended between Manhattan’s Steve Masiello and South Florida after it was revealed the coach had lied about graduating from Kentucky in 2000....
docs.lead_paragraph: Talks ended between Manhattan’s Steve Masiello and South Florida after it was revealed the coach had lied about graduating from Kentucky in 2000.
docs.abstract: College Basketball Notebook column; talks break down between Manhattan Coach Steve Masiello and South Florida after South Florida officials discover an inaccuracy on his resume, which lists him as having graduated from University of Kentucky in 2000; Manhattan officials say Masiello has been put on leave while his degree status is reviewed.

headline.main: Manhattan Coach Is Denied South Florida Job After Résumé Check
headline.print_headline: Check of Résumé Costs Coach New Job and Threatens Current One

byline.original: By ZACH SCHONBRUN and MATT KRUPNICK

docs.snippet: Aaron Thomas scored 14 of his 21 points in the second half as host Florida State defeated Louisiana Tech, 78-75, to advance to the National Invitation Tournament semifinals....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aaron Thomas scored 14 of his 21 points in the second half as host Florida State defeated Louisiana Tech, 78-75, to advance to the National Invitation Tournament semifinals.
docs.abstract: Florida State defeats Louisiana Tech, 78-75, to advance to National Invitation Tournament semifinals; other college basketball news noted.

docs.snippet: A campaign ad for Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky showed a celebrating college basketball team in blue and white uniforms: Duke, not the University of Kentucky....
docs.lead_paragraph: A campaign ad for Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky showed a celebrating college basketball team in blue and white uniforms: Duke, not the University of Kentucky.
docs.abstract: Re-election team of Sen Mitch McConnell, Kentucky Republican, releases campaign ad showing a celebrating college basketball team in blue and white uniforms, but team is Duke, not the University of Kentucky; it is latest blunder in McConnell's re-election bid.

headline.main: With Videos, McConnell Finds More Bloopers Than Hits
headline.print_headline: With Videos, McConnell Finds More Bloopers Than Hits

docs.lead_paragraph: Watch what you tweet, sports fans.

headline.main: Security Firms Watch Social Media for Feisty Fans

docs.snippet: Northwestern football players are university employees and entitled to a union election, a regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Northwestern football players are university employees and entitled to a union election, a regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Wednesday.
docs.abstract: Peter Ohr, regional director of the National Labor Relations Board, rules that group of football players at Northwestern are employees of the university and have the right to form a union and bargain collectively; ruling could give momentum to push for college athletes to be compensated at a time when the NCAA and its largest conferences are generating billions of dollars, primarily from football and men’s basketball.

headline.main: College Players Granted Right to Form Union
headline.print_headline: College Players Granted Right to Form Union

byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and STEVE EDER

headline.main: A Victory for Athletes as University Employees
